com.hannesdorfmann.mosby3.mvp.delegate

Interface MvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>,VS extends ViewState<V>>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    MvpDelegateCallback<V,P>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ViewGroupMvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V,P,VS>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MvpLceViewStateActivity, MvpLceViewStateFragment, MvpViewStateActivity, MvpViewStateFragment, MvpViewStateFrameLayout, MvpViewStateLinearLayout, MvpViewStateRelativeLayout

    public interface MvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>,VS extends ViewState<V>>
extends MvpDelegateCallback<V,P>
    An enhanced version of MvpDelegateCallback that adds ViewState support. This interface must be implemented by all (subclasses of) Activity and Fragment that want to support ViewState and mvp.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    See Also:
    ViewGroupMvpViewStateDelegateCallback

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      VS createViewState()
      Create the viewstate.
      VS getViewState()
      Get the viewState
      boolean isRestoringViewState() 
      void onNewViewStateInstance()
      Called if a new ViewState has been created because no viewstate from a previous Activity or Fragment instance could be restored.
      void onViewStateInstanceRestored(boolean instanceStateRetained)
      Called if the ViewState instance has been restored successfully.
      void setRestoringViewState(boolean restoringViewState)
      This method will be called by MvpViewStateInternalDelegate to inform that restoring the view state is in progress.
      void setViewState(VS viewState)
      Set the viewstate.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.hannesdorfmann.mosby3.mvp.delegate.MvpDelegateCallback

        createPresenter, getMvpView, getPresenter, setPresenter

    • Method Detail

      • getViewState

        VS getViewState()
        Get the viewState

      • setViewState

        void setViewState(VS viewState)
        Set the viewstate. Should only be called by MvpViewStateInternalDelegate

      • createViewState

        VS createViewState()
        Create the viewstate.

      • setRestoringViewState

        void setRestoringViewState(boolean restoringViewState)
        This method will be called by MvpViewStateInternalDelegate to inform that restoring the view state is in progress.
        Parameters:
        restoringViewState - true, if restoring viewstate is in progress, otherwise false

      • isRestoringViewState

        boolean isRestoringViewState()
        Returns:
        true if the viewstate is restoring right now (not finished yet). Otherwise false.

      • onViewStateInstanceRestored

        void onViewStateInstanceRestored(boolean instanceStateRetained)
        Called if the ViewState instance has been restored successfully.

        In this method you have to restore the viewstate by reading the view state properties and setup the view to be on the same state as before.

        Parameters:
        instanceStateRetained - true, if the viewstate has been restored from memory, otherwise false (viewstate has been restored from Bundle)

      • onNewViewStateInstance

        void onNewViewStateInstance()
        Called if a new ViewState has been created because no viewstate from a previous Activity or Fragment instance could be restored.

        Typically this is called on the first time the Activity or Fragment starts and therefore no view state instance previously exists
